meanings.definition: The state or quality of being flaccid.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained the patient's flaccidities as a sign of muscle weakness.
meanings.sent2: The flaccidities of the deflated balloon made it impossible to blow up again.
meanings.sent3: The flaccidities of the old rubber band were no match for the new one in the office contest.
meanings.sent4: His flaccidities in decision-making led to missed opportunities in his career.
meanings.sent5: The tree branches swayed with the flaccidities of the wind, bending easily in its path.

meanings.sent1: The pillow's flaccidities made it uncomfortable to sleep on.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the flaccidities of the overripe fruit as she picked it up.
meanings.sent3: The flaccidities of the overcooked pasta made it unappetizing to the guests.
meanings.sent4: The flaccidities of the old mattress caused back pain for the sleeper.
meanings.sent5: The flaccidities of the worn-out rubber band made it snap easily.

meanings.sent1: The team's flaccidities in defense cost them the game.
meanings.sent2: His flaccidities in motivation affected his productivity at work.
meanings.sent3: The flaccidities of the tired puppy made it hard for him to keep up with the others.
meanings.sent4: She felt the flaccidities of her resolve weakening as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The flaccidities of the old rope were evident as it struggled to hold the weight.
